ere are the triplets extracted from the text:

<Mehu
11:
--------------------
Text: Mehu:  Mehu was bearing a high number of important titles.

Triplets:<Mehu
12:
--------------------
Text: Mehu:  These include the titles of the vizier, but he was also Overseer of the treasuries, overseer of the double granary, overseer of Upper Egypt and overseer of all royal works.
Triplets:<Overseer of the treasuries
14:
--------------------
Text: Mehu:  One son was perhaps called Mery, but his name was several times deleted.
Triplets:<Mehu
15:
--------------------
Text: Mehu:  Another son was Hetepka.
Triplets:<Mehu
17:
--------------------
Text: Mehu:  It is possible that he was the son of Mehu, albeit final evidence for this identification is missing.

Triplets:<Mehu
18:
--------------------
Text: Mehu:  The vizier Hetepka might have been just a member of Mehu's family.
Triplets:<Mehu
